text:
Hi Guys,

Hope you are doing well.

I am new to HubSpot and want to learn web development.

After going through the out-of-the-box functionalities, I feel that to incorporate the custom design in HubSpot I need to create custom modules and use them on the website.
Please suggest if I have the wrong understanding.

For example, to create the following calculator on the website I need to create a calculator module and use it.

Please suggest to me which certification or courses I need to cover to have this skill (To create configurable modules in HubSpot).

Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
Hey all, I have inherited a very poor looking unsubscribe page. Has anyone got a modern looking Unsubscribe template/ code that are I can play around with?

Heya,

I am trying to add an "Add to Calendar" button onto a landing page. AddEvent generates one with a code. But if I try and add the source code into a rich text module, the CMS strips out a lot of the code.

If there any better way to add this to the page?
why its showing URL is invalid? any idea?

I would recommend inserting an `Embed` into the Rich Text. You can do that via `Insert -> Embed` and then paste your embed code.

Embeds provide a container to scripts, etc. in an embed that would otherwise be stripped from the RTE source code for security reasons.
Ah genius, Logan. I missed that option. This is excellent thank you.
